title: Amazing Company
pros: Since joining this organization, the experience has been a breath of fresh air. The management team and colleagues within the Channel program are collaborative, approachable, and highly effective. The culture strikes the right balance, everyone is easygoing yet focused on delivering results. I feel valued as an individual rather than just a number, and the support provided enables me to perform at my best with minimal distractions. Unlike previous roles, I leave work feeling energized rather than drained, and I’m genuinely excited about the work I’m doing. It’s rare for me to share this level of enthusiasm before a one-year mark, but I find myself talking to friends and family about how positive this experience has been. The benefits are also STELLAR!
cons: The only con I have is the disparate systems but they are already working on merging the SFDC instances.

title: Great Benefits - Poor Leadership
pros: Benefits and Pay are top tier. Facilities are great. Very clean and safe. Corporate resources are very advanced.
cons: Leadership is poor quality at the Regional Level. Very toxic environment. Promoting from within without proper experience, education, qualifications. I had great experiences with the Global Teams and Leaders, but not in the Central US Region. Very wasteful and close-minded. Inefficient and Ineffective leadership caused silence and lack of collaboration, very toxic. No one (in the region) feels comfortable asking questions so things are not done consistently or thoroughly. It is symptomatic of a bad apple spoiling the whole bunch. If they cleaned house of the toxins, they would be absolutely perfect!

title: Not Recommended
pros: Decent PTO. Lots of OT. Good pay & Benefits
cons: Long hours. No growth opportunities. Kinda a an absolute mess of an organization.

title: Salary
pros: Fair salary and a bonus
cons: Favoritism is often at play

title: Mixed Bag
pros: Good Benefits and Pay, easy job
cons: Contracted work does not allow learning. Politics can get in the way of the safest practice. hard to move up

title: Great company, but has room for improvement
pros: The PTO is generous, growing company with opportunities, local leadership cares and listens even at the director level. A lot of smart and highly technical employees that love talking your ear off! I feel like I learn something almost everyday.
cons: Certain departments appeared to be favored over others, no good way of tracking and listening to employees ideas like a ticketing system- you have a lot of intelligent people working here that can vastly improve the business and a lot of them stopped pushing for change because it doesnt seem to go anywhere. The pay is below the market and unfortunately we lose employees to our customers often.

title: Culture
pros: Great place to work, excellent leadership.
cons: Increase headcount with more support roles.

cons: No RSU's, promotions don't come to you unless you ask them (common in most places, a lot of work to do with small team, communication.

title: Great Company

title: Generally Positive

cons: Large company, sometimes bureacratic. Not as much career mobility

title: Entry Level Data Center
pros: - Simplistic - Good Pay - Friendly Environment - Rapidly Growing Overall a great place to work, but the con to this place is what can make it hard to retain employees when other data centers are willing to pay more.
cons: - Career progression depends on who you know. - Backfilling employees is unhurried - New hire hopefuls may have to wait 2-6 months just for an interview

title: Salaries not competitive
pros: Decent work life balance Nice people Solid industry Unlimited PTO, good benefits
cons: Roles not clearly defined Salaries are a disaster and likely based on who you report to, I'd guess there is not much parity. I believe they do not compete well in the market and have removed all salary data from the internet. Got a job offer and structure of the offer was stretched out so that the full number would not be realized for <2 years Exec Management says jump and everyone does so, shifting priorities are tough, everything is a firedrill Extremely layered, matrixed, you will be put in your place Limited upward mobility, based on team

title: Don’t do it!

title: Dear Digital Realty Newcomers
pros: Great Opportunity for growth and learning. You can elevate fast in the company if you put the work in. Great Management, very supportive management team. Great Salary, Great work/life balance. Management cares about things you have going on in your life outside of work, they always do check ins with staff to see how we're feeling mentally and within the company. Very genuine energy that is not common these days in jobs.
cons: Different personalities and attitudes within the team. Sometimes it is flat out hard to deal with and mentally draining. Clicky work environment, if you don't fit in you can feel left out.

title: Product Manager Review
pros: Pros include: culture, compensation and benefits.
cons: Organizational structure made it difficult to get things done.

title: salary review at Digital realty
pros: to get some exposure to the technology and IT fields
cons: low salary and less opportunity for career growth.

title: Just don't. It's so not worth it.
pros: Cutting edge industry Global exposure
cons: Just...everything. if you're looking for a slave trader to tell you one thing and do another then this is the place for you! Family first? Corporate propaganda says NO. Reality? Ask the kids of former employees about that work life balance family first Corporate mask. You don't matter. 16,17,18 hours a day and still not enough to the point that E level management is pushing for more. Your mom died? Too bad, it's quarter end. Grieve on your own time. Covid? You're clearly a snowflake to be eliminated. Vacation? Don't expect anyone to cover you. All 3,000 emails and problems will be waiting for you when you get back from your sabbatical. But who wants more than a 5 day vacay anyway? It's a dead end job with no potential for growth or change that will destroy your will to live.

pros: Great people, culture and work/life balance.

title: Stable Company Poised for Long Term Growth
pros: Stability and growth from high demand for new data centers worldwide. Finance executives seem very capable of raising capital, managing capital structure, and executing deals to expand global footprint. Entrepreneurial spirit. Many proud, long term employees with a united purpose.
cons: Very complex international business structure made some business functions difficult. Deficient legacy enterprise business software contributed to long hours. Tendency to pile on too many projects and initiatives (unrelated to construction) without vetting, ranking, or capacity planning. Some collaboration and voluntary information exchange issues between corporate departments and technology groups.
